story:
Hi There!

My name is Katie Sadie. I am a portrait and fashion photographer working out of Toronto, Ontario Canada. I have worked along side some extremely talented photographers, make up artists, designers, art directors and stylists for the past 6 years. 

At this point in my career I would like to use what I have learned and take my studio on the road to develop a massive street and documentary photo essay. So, this means I am selling all of my belongings and packing up my studio to hit the road. 

I will be living in a van for 6  months; capturing rural, run down America and the human interaction with landscape.The road trip will also illustrate through photography, events in people’s lives that happen so fast and so often that we view them as nothingness. Using photography, I aim to make the viewer question, re-think and become curious about everyday tools that we use, objects we pass by and gestures we act out from day to day. I will be using a Pentax 6x7, Canon 5D Mark III and Minolta 7000 to document the entire trip.

The road trip will allow me to stop in as many States as possible within a 6 month period. I will leave from Toronto, Ontario  towards Los Angeles, California and then make my way back to Toronto taking a completely different route. 

The goal is to publish a book and have a legendary gallery opening when I return. 

Picture yourself on a bus headed towards New York City, for example, and there is a pit stop in Syracuse but you’ve only been given 10 minutes to grab a soda pop or hit the bathroom. This trip allows for the exploration of those smaller towns and pit stops we’ve all been to in passing but were unable to explore.

Street and documentary photography inspirations:
Elliott Erwitt, Josef Koudelka, Amy Stein, Michael Wolf, Helen Levitt, Wee Gee, 

Jeff Brouws, Camilo Vergara

“I photograph to find out what something will look like photographed.” – Garry Winogrand


Departure Date: November 2015 

Funds will be used but not limited to:

-Film

-Gas

-Vehicle 

Thank you so much for any contribution you are able to make! 

Follow my journey @goldenboystudio, #tripaboutnothing

story:
Our Story

Samina Baig, first Pakistani female mountaineer and one of the creative and driving forces behind the Pakistan Youth Outreach, recently had to turn around 150m from the summit of a 6000m peak in the winter because she lacked one piece of crucial gear.  A piece of gear that most high altitude mountaineers don't think twice about having. A down suit.  A down suit stood between her and the summit.  The temperatures had plummeted dangerously low and without the proper equipment it was not safe to continue the climb.  Samina is just one example of the challenges women in Pakistan face mountaineering.  They overcome social limitations, lack of support, their own lack of confidence in themselves, and lack of funding to show that Pakistani women can do everything men can do, including climb a mountain.  The least of their concerns should be whether or not they can find a down suit to climb a mountain they are physically and mentally prepared for, including having all the proper mountaineering skills and experience.  And we, together, can change that to not only help Samina and the few other women mountaineers, but also help women see that they can be more than just the caretakers of the home and baby machines.


Gear for Gals in Pakistan is a fundraising project founded by Genevieve Hathaway to 1) raise money to bring women's climbing gear to the Pakistan Youth Outreach (PYO) organization, an organization aiming to bring greater gender equality through training women as mountaineers and organizing all-women mountaineering expeditions in Pakistan, and 2) assist PYO in applying for climbing grants to fund a Pakistani women's expedition climb of a 7000m peak in Pakistan during summer 2012.


This project is not just about climbing, it's about bringing greater rights to women in Pakistan.  Climbing and the outdoors is just one avenue to do that.  Mountaineering teaches self-reliance, confidence, team building skills, and shows women throughout Pakistan, not only those who participate in the PYO's mountaineering school, they are capable of more than just the domestic life. In many parts of Pakistan women cannot move around or leave their home without permission from a male relative and an escort. Much of Pakistan still has a long way to go in raising women to equal standing with men and reducing violence against women.  The school drop out rate for women is high at almost 50 percent.  In urban areas women only comprise 28% of the work force.  Violence against women in Pakistan is still a big problem, especially poorer areas, more rural regions and in the tribal areas.


By getting more women into mountaineering it will create a ripple effect.  The women taught as mountaineers will then teach other women, through their interactions, that women have worth and can be strong, confident, independent, contributing members of society.  Helping one woman gain self-reliance and independence through mountaineering in turn helps many more.  On a larger scale, teaching women to mountaineer brings about greater gender equality by 1) demonstrating to Pakistani society that women are just as capable as men and 2) showing women throughout Pakistan that they are equal to men and deserve to be treated equally.


By contributing to this project  what is the equivalent of 3 Starbucks cups of coffee or a dinner out you can help change a woman's life in Pakistan.


For the Pakistan Youth Outreach to continue training women mountaineers and organizing climbs they need additional gear and funding.  This gear and funding is critical.  That is where you the donor come in.  Your donations help the much needed climbing gear reach the PYO in Pakistan and for targeted grant applications to be developed and submitted.


The Impact

The Gear for Gals in Pakistan project will help Pakistan Youth Outreach (PYO) organization impact young Pakistani women's lives by empowering them through the skills and confidence they learn mountaineering.  The gear and grant applications will help PYO continue to train more and more women in mountaineering, and organize and execute all-women climbs.  These growing number of women mountaineers and all-women expeditions will inspire other women in Pakistan to participate in adventure sports and mountaineering.  It will also show women that they can be self-reliant, strong, confident and ambitious; encouraging young women not to be limited by societal constraints, but to challenge the status quo and strive for equality.  The aim is to not just change women's minds, but influence Pakistani society as a whole to think of women as equal members.   

PYO's influence is not limited to Pakistan. This organization is showing other countries that Pakistani women are not just the victims seen on tv.  There are major concerns in Pakistan with the level of violence committed against women.  But, that is not the whole story.  Women in Pakistan are organizing complex and challenging expedition climbs of 7000m mountains.

What We Need & What You Get

Climbing mountains is expensive and requires a lot of technical climbing gear.  The Gear for Gals in Pakistan project is raising $3500 to fund 1) transporting crucial women's climbing gear to the Pakistan Youth Outreach (PYO) organization in Pakistan and 2) developing content for climbing grants to fund an all-women's climb of a 7000m peak in Pakistan during July 2012 and grant application production and submission. Video, photography and written content will be developed and produced for the following grants: American Alpine Club, First Ascent, Mugs Stump Alpine Climbing Award, Balance Bar, Polartec, and National Geographic grants.

The $3500 covers the extra baggage and overweight baggage charges (which are quite hefty) by Continental and Omen Airlines,  the expensive extra baggage charge for flying the gear from Islamabad to Shimshal where the climbing courses take place, custom fees to bring the gear into Pakistan, lens rental fees, cost to purchase an HD microphone, cost of video and photography editing software to produce grant application video content, and the administrative fees IndieGoGo charges to host this fundraiser on their website.

Why fly the gear over instead of ship it?  Climbing gear and clothing is difficult to purchase in Pakistan and just as difficult to ship due to shipping costs and customs regulations.  Many gear companies and online stores do not ship to Pakistan and few stores in-country sell climbing gear. Also, theft of shipped items does occur when shipping to Pakistan,. The easier, more reliable and cost-effective method is for the gear to be flown to Pakistan via commercial airlines.

We need you to make this project a reality and help these Pakistani women!


Every donation helps, no matter how small. And to say thank you, we have a few thank you gifts at different donation levels that include: a postcard from Pakistan, a high quality print of the women this program helps, dinner and a speaker on this project, traditional crafts from Pakistan, and much more.  See side column for furhter details.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us make some noise about this project! Whether or not you can contribute funds at this time, there are still many ways for you to become part of our team and contribute to the success of this project.  Here are a few ways to help:


  • Spread the word about Gear for Gals in Pakistan project to friends, family, co-workers.
  • Forward this page and encourage people to do the same.  The more visitors to this page the higher it rates on IndieGoGo standings, increasing its chance of being listed as a feature project.
  • Forward this project onto other potential donors, whether individuals or organizations.
  • Like us on Facebook. http://www.facebook.com/GearForGalsPakistan
  • Spread the word about our project via twitter.
  • Inform media outlets of this project.
  • If you are a gear company interested in donating new or used gear contact us at genevieve@alpineathena.com

GEAR DONORS

story:
Meet Dot

The World's Smallest GPS Locator To Find Anything Important

Anywhere In The World

 

Overview

At a Glance

 

What's diffrent about Dot?

  

   

Bluetooth trackers, like Tile and TrackR, are great for finding things like keys and phone that are not far away. GPS trackers already exist but they are large, have expensive data plans. We need a simpler solution to instantly locate anything important.

 

 

 

Instant Charge

 Allow you to connect Dot to your cable quickly and seamlessly.

 

 

The free AIBEILE App, available for iOS and Android, makes it incredibly fast and easy to find what's most valuable.

 

 

" Wake Up Me "

It flashes with blue light and music when you start up Dot.

 

 

How It Works

 

 

Dot Anything Important

Dot anyone or anything that matters and stay

connected no matter how far away they are.

 

Dot kids wherever they go

Find your wandering pet

Locate your beloved one

Find your missing backpack

Never forget where you parked

Dot for outdoor security

 

 

Select Your Perk

Available in black & white color

 

Global Range

Dot uses GPS+BD+WIFI+LBS+AGPS auxiliary positioning to provide the most accurate possible location for each device. 

 

GPS is used to locate the device within 65 feet of your location, WIFI  within 164 feet, LBS to locate devices farther away.

 

Tech Spec

 

 

 

Timeline

We have spent almost a year searching for reliable and capable manufacturers, consulting project design with different designers, and rigorously testing prototypes. We can now safely and proudly say: We are ready to produce Dot!

Shipping

 

#DotGPSTracker - Help Out By Sharing With Friends

Just several seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the Dot community. Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who needs this!

Please contact sunnyshawxy@gmail.com with further questions or inquiries.
story_txt: Meet DotThe World's Smallest GPS Locator To Find Anything ImportantAnywhere In The World OverviewAt a Glance What's diffrent about Dot?     Bluetooth trackers, like Tile and TrackR, are great for finding things like keys and phone that are not far away. GPS trackers already exist but they are large, have expensive data plans. We need a simpler solution to instantly locate anything important.   Instant Charge Allow you to connect Dot to your cable quickly and seamlessly.  The free AIBEILE App, available for iOS and Android, makes it incredibly fast and easy to find what's most valuable.  " Wake Up Me "It flashes with blue light and music when you start up Dot.  How It Works  Dot Anything ImportantDot anyone or anything that matters and stayconnected no matter how far away they are. Dot kids wherever they goFind your wandering petLocate your beloved oneFind your missing backpackNever forget where you parkedDot for outdoor security  Select Your PerkAvailable in black & white color Global RangeDot uses GPS+BD+WIFI+LBS+AGPS auxiliary positioning to provide the most accurate possible location for each device.  GPS is used to locate the device within 65 feet of your location, WIFI  within 164 feet, LBS to locate devices farther away. Tech Spec   TimelineWe have spent almost a year searching for reliable and capable manufacturers, consulting project design with different designers, and rigorously testing prototypes. We can now safely and proudly say: We are ready to produce Dot!Shipping #DotGPSTracker - Help Out By Sharing With FriendsJust several seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the Dot community. Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who needs this!Please contact sunnyshawxy@gmail.com with further questions or inquiries.

story:
I am building a one room cabin on some family land in the foothills of the Sierra Nevada range in southern Wyoming.  My family has had a ranch here for over 100 years and we are so far off the grid that we have had to learn how to live without conventional sources of power since we settled here in the 1800s, where we have been ranching continuously. (The photo above is not of my project- it's merely an example of our building technique)

For a long time, living off the grid here meant diesel generators and an old windmill.  We have evolved, in that we are using a better windmill and solar systems, but our building practices are still fairly standard.  My cousins built a straw bale earth sheltered house on one end of the ranch a few years ago, and that inspired me to build this small cabin for myself.  

We have found a wonderful builder who is familiar with natural building techniques and he is training a volunteer crew. He has a permaculture demonstration farm and CSA in San Jose del Cabo, Baja, where he utilizes these methods.  We are offering tours to local residents and family who wish to learn about building methods that are less expensive, more earth friendly, more durable and sustainable.  The main material we are going to be using is bags filled with a stabilized mix of earth and lime, tamped down, cured, and covered with an earthen plaster.

We are using local logs for the interior timberframing that are standing dead and/or fallen, which will reduce the local fuel for wildfires.  The fill for the earth bags was excavated directly from below the site.  We were fortunate to find soil that was the exact right mix of clay and sand. 

What I need:

I need funding to complete the building.  Our foundation has been built, the trench for the walls has been filled with gravel and rubble, and we have most of the equipment, logs, and bags we need.  Unfortunately, due to some cost overages, as well as the need to purchase some expensive insurance we didn't anticipate, we need a bit more to finish the cabin.  This includes feeding a very hungry crew of 6 men and one woman for the rest of the summer!  We will also need to purchase the roofing and the glass for the windows.  (Also our builder's dog got run over so we need to pay the vet!!) 

Take a look at our blog:

http://evdahhh.tumblr.com/


If we go over our goal, I will spend the additional funds on creating an outdoor kitchen with a cob oven for myself and my siblings who are restoring some log cabins nearby.  If we do not reach out goal, we will still use and appreciate all we recieve and keep building!

 In the end, we hope to create an uplifting, peaceful, shelter that has minimal impact on it's surroundings, and educate local residents and family about natural building techniques that they most likely have never heard of.  And have a great time doing it!

If you love our project but can't contribute, please pass this along to someone who might be able to!  Please utilize the Indegogo share tools.  Thanks so much!

story:
The Other Globe

Of course, this is just a theory, but the classical theory is also a theory. Besides, it's cool to have a unique visual demonstration of this beautiful ancient concept. We want to show you our unique device, The Other Globe.  


This is The Other Globe, our unique product that visualizes the Hollow Earth theory in the best possible way. In its center we shall install the inner sun imitation, a LED lamp. Thus, The Other Globe is not only a visual aid, but also a beautiful nightlight with a great story inside.

The unique globe that we create is based upon the Hollow Earth theory and the latest scientific data. Your contribution will help us create the first series of The Other Globes and The Other Maps and continue our research in this sphere.

Here's an example of our unique sectional view world map with technical data and description of Hollow Earth theory (a.k.a. The Other Map). It's a great piece of art for your interior, at home or at work. Having this map at your place, you will always be able to amaze your guests.

We deliver our products specially packed, with original logos and anti-shock protection.


                      Brief information about the Hollow Earth theory

Among innumerable theories that have ever existed besides the generally accepted one, the Hollow Earth theory is the most unusual and intriguing. Unlike other nonconformist hypotheses, it has lots of material evidences. Here you'll find a brief overview of arguments and facts that, in a way or another, support the Hollow Earth theory, and a review of its historical development.

The Hollow Earth theory is much older than it may seem. The idea that the Earth has a void inside was suggested by the ancient philosophers and scientists. Of course, this idea was based on myths and beliefs of ancient people. Almost every ancient religion had its underworld, a mysterious place that was located literally under our feet. The Greek Tartarus, the Jewish Sheol, the Christian Hell - they all are interpretations of incipient Hollow Earth theory by our ancestors that explained every unclear phenomenon by means of religion. The idea of a subterranean realm is also mentioned in Tibetan Buddhism belief, where it is referred as Shamballa.

These and many other religions, so dispersed in time and space, have in common a certain world structure, and the emptiness under the ground is its essential part, as well as the opportunity to get into it. The Bible is also ambiguous when it comes to this issue: “Then God said, "Let there be an expanse in the midst of the waters, and let it separate the waters from the waters." God made the expanse, and separated the waters which were below the expanse from the waters which were above the expanse; and it was so.” (Genesis, 1:6-7)

The first man to justify the Hollow Earth theory scientifically was Edmond Halley, the famous British astronomer who is best known for computing the orbit of the comet that is now named after him. In 1692, he put forth the idea that the Earth has more than one magnetic field, each with its force and orientation. His conclusive theory stated that there are four concentric spheres with their own magnetic fields.

Halley's longest shot was the suggestion that inner atmospheres separated these shells. He envisaged each inner region as being luminous (and possibly inhabited). Halley backed up his theory with Aurora Borealis that was caused by gas escaping from the inner Earth through polar holes.

Halley was the early pioneer of the Hollow Earth theory, and all his disciples used his ideas as a basis for their own research. In the 18th century Leonhard Euler, a great mathematician, restructured Halley's hypothesis. In his opinion, under the Earth crust and magma layers there was one hollow sphere. He assumed that there was another sun inside this sphere 600 miles across to provide light for an inner-Earth civilization. Another well-known mathematician, Sir John Leslie, also supported the inner sun theory - in fact, in his opinion, there were two inner suns that he named Pluto and Proserpine.

One of the most ardent supporters of the Hollow Earth theory was John Cleves Symmes Jr., an American army officer.

He was absolutely sure that inside our planet there is a shell with openings at both poles (4000 miles across on the North Pole and 6000 - on the South Pole). Symmes spent most of his wealth and a considerable part of his life to promote his theory. In April 1818 he sent out 500 copies of his message to US congressmen, university presidents and leading scientists. It said: “TO ALL THE WORLD! I declare the earth is hollow, and habitable within; containing a number of solid concentric spheres, one within the other, and that it is open at the poles 12 or 16 degrees; I pledge my life in support of this truth, and am ready to explore the hollow, if the world will support and aid me in the undertaking. I ask one hundred brave companions, well equipped, to start from Siberia in the fall season, with reindeer and sleighs, on the ice of the frozen sea: I engage we find a warm and rich land, stocked with thrifty vegetables and animals if not men, on reaching one degree northward of latitude 82.” This address, however, was taken for a ride; Symmes' efforts were lost in vain, but his belief made the Hollow Earth theory very popular.

In 1846, an extinct woolly mammoth was discovered frozen in Siberian ice. Another Hollow Earth theory enthusiast, Marshall Gardner, used it as evidence of this theory. He suggested that the mammoth was so well preserved because it had died recently. Gardner thought that mammoths and other extinct creatures wandered freely in the interior of the earth. This one had wandered outside by using the hole at the North Pole, then was frozen and carried to Siberia on an ice flow.

Gardner was also the first to design a realistic model of Hollow Earth with an interior shell; he even patented his model. In fact, Gardner's theory was one of the most scientifically grounded. In 1913, he affirmed that neither Frederick Cook, nor Robert Peary managed to reach the geographic North Pole and that the decisions of the scientific community in this concern are inaccurate and conventional. The results of Cook and Peary's expeditions are still controversial.

Miguel Serrano, Chilean politician and Antarctic explorer, in his article expressed his firm belief in the existence of the underground world. "It is important to study and develop the arguments of the hollow earth theory. I see them only as a repetition or revival of the ancient idea, set out in many myths and legends. In my belief, the earth is split into two parts and bent inward, so that anyone who enters the 83rd degrees north or south latitude, does not see what is inside the planet. The force of gravity lies in the middle of the earth's crust, which has a thickness of 800 miles. On the back of the earth's crust could be continents and seas, forests, mountains and rivers, which are inhabited by one in the old days had come back in the development of our superior race."

Not only scientists supported the Hollow Earth theory. In 1930-40's German Nazis had organized several expeditions to the poles. It is documented that Nazi submarines have found a huge system of landlocked cavities forming shells with warm air near Queen Maud Land. The above-mentioned Serrano suggested that part of the Nazi officers were evacuated to these shelters shortly before the end of the World War II.

Karl Dönitz, German naval commander, gave a speech in front of a German submarine in 1944, when he claimed "The German submarine fleet is proud of having built an invisible fortification for the Fuhrer, anywhere in the world." Historians affirm that at the end of the war three submarines were loaded with Nazi officers and relics of the Third Reich and transported to the Antarctic. After this, the empty submarines surrendered to the Allies in Mar del Plata, Argentine.

In 1946-47, US Navy organized the Operation Highjump to research the Nazi activity in the Antarctic. Rear admiral Richard E. Byrd conducted the operation. After several months of work, aerial photography and polar station establishing, the expedition members reported of being attacked by an unidentified enemy. In March 1947 all works were aborted, and the expedition came back to the United States. The documents were immediately classified. Only the next year newspapers started writing about 68 dead members of the crew and heavy damage to planes and ships. In his report to the presidential panel, admiral Byrd spoke about some strange flying objects that came from under the ground. After his report, Byrd was forcedly put into mental health facility for 5 years. It's worth mentioning that he was released and granted a leading post in the US Navy, when mass media was no longer interested in this story. So, government did not consider him crazy after all. Nowadays admiral Byrd's diary is one of the proofs of the Hollow Earth theory.

Of course, new technologies could provide more opportunities to study this hypothesis. On November 23, 1968 an American meteorological satellite ESSA 7 transmitted several unique photos of the polar region. It is extremely rare that photos taken from this angle of approach have no clouds on them. In the polar region, a funnel-like opening is clearly seen. Similar photos were taken in the southern polar region.

Another evidence of the hollowness of Earth is aurora borealis, or northern lights. For a long time this phenomenon was considered to be generated by protons and neutrons penetrating the rare atmosphere from outer space. There are many documented affirmations made by Fridtjof Nansen and other explorers about fire flashes going up from the horizon, but they were all ignored. However, photos made by NASA satellites demonstrate that polar lights come from the inner space, not the outer space, and form a ring-like figure around the opening in the southern polar region.

Common logic suggests that every question can have more than one answer. Tunnel thinking sometimes makes it impossible for us to neglect alternative versions. There are many theories that explain the world structure, and Hollow Earth theory is one of the most estimable. Brushing aside the speculations about super-civilizations living on the inner surface of the Earth, we can assume that this theory has scientific grounds - seismological data, gravity recovery and climate experiments, studies of the electromagnetic field of the Earth, etc.

Now that you've found out more about the Hollow Earth theory, you can help us distribute this idea. There's much more information about this theory, you can find it on the internet or we can subscribe you to our exclusive newsletter. You can contribute to our campaign financially or by spreading this information via Indiegogo share tools. Thank you for supporting us!

story:
Short Summary

Hello my name is Ernest Harris and I am the creator of Da'Strap, my son Jahi Harris is the heart and  promotion behind Da'Strap. My motivation behind Da'Strap was just to create a product that made
skateboarding more enjoyable for the user !
I can say I started paying attention to skateboarders, and the
problems they were having holding they're boards back in 1999, and
realizing it was problem that could be solved. So I started creating a
way of holding the board via a strap.
I went thru numerous designs, until 13 years later, I was finally
satisfied. I applied for my U.S. Patent, and it was granted. And with
the help of my son, we presented Da'Strap to the public.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are looking to raise $100,000 for "Product Inventory , Marketing Campaign , Promotion and to build our company"  
  • Da'Strap is starting to make a name for itself, we are in 5 skate shops including the well known "Maui & Sons Surf and Skate Shop" on the Venice Beach Strip. Da'Strap was also featured in the blockbuster film "The Purge Anarchy" and last year we made it to the second round of the popular tv show "Shark Tank" .
  • The funds will go to the same thing we are raising the money for just on a lower scale.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

    The success with this product has been amazing, we have been accepted into 5 popular skate shops. We are getting amazing feedback from customers asking "where has this product been all my life" and we have been getting product placement in movies and vine videos.  By contributing to this new and unique product your are making it possible to provide a useful product to the worldwide skateboarding industry


Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • What qualifies us is the fact that we have never given up and we have maintained our diligence in pursueing our goal in providing our product to a worldwide in industry
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges. By creation a product and by adding proffesional marketing strategies we can increase the products exposure ie branding.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If your can not contribute we would appreciate your comments aswell as sharing our page to get the word out
  • !

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The story behind Tagonce

Everything is set – you’re on your way on vacation and are just in time for your flight. You reach the airport and scan the check-in area for a luggage tag on which you can quickly jot down your contact information. Either you don’t find one or if you do you may end up not having time enough to write your contact information in a readable manner before you reach the check in counter for your luggage – sounds familiar? 

This exact scenario played itself out over and over for my wife and I when we were flying. Finally, on a trip to Paris my wife and I said to each other: Clearly there must be an easier solution for this. But there wasn't, so we created Tagonce.

What is Tagonce?

Imagine that...  

  • You don't have to write the same contact information on your luggage tag every time you travel
  • You can update your contact information at any time and from anywhere using your smartphone 
  • You can plan multiple journeys by entering future dates and places you are planning to stay and your contact information will change automatically based on this info 
  • You don't have to search for a luggage tag, at the airport 
  • You don't have to remember a pen 
  • People can easily scan and read your tag without the app  
  • People can send you messages using their smartphone if they find your luggage

Imagine Tagonce


  • The QR code is immersed in the product on all our designs, leaving it 100% scratch resistant
  • NFC enabled tags are available
  • The software and tag is designed, developed and produced in Denmark.  
  • The projected price at retail is $10 per tag. Get it here for a price as low as $7

How does it work?

1. Attach the Tagonce tag to your lugagge and scan the tag

When you scan your tag the first time, you will be guided to download and install the Tagonce app. After you have attached the tag, you never have to take it off again.

2. Enter your basic contact information

You only have to enter your basic information once.

3. Enter where and when you are going

The app allows you to enter multiple future destinations, to and from dates.

4. Enjoy your trip. The tag is now setup to display your contact information when scanned

Now your tag will display the right information at the right time based on the dates you have entered.


Anyone with a smartphone is able to read your tag. The app is not needed.

If plans change, or you have to plan a new trip - you simply open the app and change the plans without needing to have your luggage next to you.

Our tags

We currently offer 9 different kinds of tags. Six simple tags with a QR code and 3 tags with both NFC chip and QR code: 


QR + NFC - Clear

QR + NFC - Moonlight White

QR + NFC - Midnight Black

Our straps

You get 3 straps per tag you order - each one in a different color:  

  • The black tag comes with a red, transparent and black strap 
  • The white tag comes with a purple, transparent and black strap 
  • The transparent tag comes with a green, transparent and black strap

These are the straps:


App features


Finder features

The luggage owner can be located on Google Maps, texted or emailed with the click of a button by the finder of the luggage using a smartphone.

If the finder doesn't want to call or email the luggage owner, the finder can simply choose to enter a message with contact information, so that the owner has to contact the finder instead. In this case the owner gets notified via email and is able to read the message using the app.

Here is an example below of what the finder will be presented after having scanned the luggage tag. In this scenario I am only sharing my home adress and contact information - not information on where I am staying - something that can be customized in the setting section of the app.

Material and specs

Tag material: Acrylic  

Acrylic print and coating: In order to imprint the tags with the QR code and text, we have in cooperation with one of the leading suppliers of acrylic-solutions in Denmark, found an easy way to print and coat the tags. By doing so we have ensured flexible and easy production yet a very scratch resistant tag that will withstand the rough environment of luggage transportation.

Tags measurements: The tag thickness is 3 millimeter.

Tags colors : White: Moonligt white,  Black: Midnight black, Transparent: Standard perspex clear

Strap length: 6 inches / 15 cm long. 

Strap material: We have chosen silicone due to its flexible yet durable performance.

What's next ?

We’re already discussing the next features in the app that among other things will let you keep a more advanced travel log as well as give you the option of finding or connecting with friends who have the same travel interests as you – making Tagonce a unique social platform for travelers:  

Travel log: log airlines used, hotels, restaurants, attractions and rate them – add images, texts and videos, possible integration with existing travel apps/sites. Integration with Google.

Connect with friends: Connect with existing friends or find new ones with same travel interests as yourself. Check out their travel logs for the cities/countries you’re interested in, comment etc.

story:
Hello Everyone! 

We are Jenny, Esther, Boma, Tasnima, Kevin, Adi and Yusuf (not pictured), students from the University at Buffalo who have been selected to participate in our schools alternative fall break program (Wednesday, November 27th - Sunday, December 1) to New York City. Thanks to the great diversity of our school, our team offers a unique mix of students from different backgrounds.

We will be working with the volunteer organization, New York Cares. New York Cares was founded in the 1980's by a group of people who wanted to take action against serious social issues that faced New York City. New York Cares is now the city's largest volunteer organization, running volunteer programs for 1,300 nonprofits, city agencies, and public schools. It has now been almost a year since Hurricane Sandy arrived in New York City and, while the storm has passed and the flood waters have receded, New York Cares continues to mobilize volunteers to meet the still-pressing needs of affected communities. 

Alternative break programs engage students in experiential learning through community service and volunteerism during their fall (Thanksgiving), winter or spring break. The projects the students participate with address issues such as poverty, homelessness, hunger, literacy, HIV/AIDS, education and the environment. The objective of the Alternative Breaks program is to involve students in service projects to learn about the problems of a community they would typically not know about. The goal is for students to take the intensity of the program/experience and transfer the lessons learned to their own community upon their return. We hope students learn how they can become agents of change, make a difference in their community and lead a life of active citizenship. Our trip will be video documented and shared to this page following the trip.

We are excited and commited to our service but as students, we are finacially limited. Our goal is to raise at least $500 for our NYC trip. All proceeds from this campaign will go to directly towards travel, food, and lodging costs.

UPDATE - Final Travel and Community Service Agenda:

Wednesday, November 27th - Drive from University at Buffalo to Brooklyn apartment (9am-4pm)

Thursday, November 28th - Serve 900 Thanksgiving meals at Hurricane Recovery Community Event (9am-4pm)

Friday, November 29th and Saturday, November 30th - Staten Island Disaster Relief Project with the Tunnel to Towers Foundation (8am-4pm)

Sunday, December 1st - Drive from Brooklyn apartment to University at Buffalo (9am-4pm)

story:
Summary

The 66 year-old Troop 204 scout cabin requires a new foundation and other repairs to be safe for future generations of scouts. Troop 204 is the oldest scout troop in Lafayette and has graduated over 350 Eagle Scouts, whose projects contributed over 35,000 hours of community service. For many years, the Troop has been setting aside surplus funds raised from the annual wreath & spray sales in anticipation of a major cabin update, but it's not enough to complete the project. We are appealing to all Troop families, 204 alumni, and friends in the Lafayette and Scouting communities to help save our cabin. 

The Troop 204 cabin at School St. & First St. in Lafayette, CA.

Major Foundational Work Required.

While basic cabin maintenance has been performed as a yearly tradition, Mother Nature and the passage of time have deteriorated the concrete foundation. The cabin, for years now, has literally been sinking into the ground. It’s time to intervene—time to act before the slanted walls and cracked foundation present safety issues or worsen beyond repair.

Due to the level of damage and the impending winter weather, construction has already begun on the foundation. The plans call for the foundation to be replaced and underpinned, the cabin to be re-leveled, and a new slab to be poured. It also needs new drainage and sewer lines, upgraded electrical systems, and other necessary code upgrades. The hope is that our building will retain its original log cabin charm, but with enough structural integrity to last well beyond another 60 years. We have gone through a detailed bidding process and awarded the contract to a highly reliable and respected contractor. The total cost of the project is estimated to be $270,000. 

 Construction of the cabin in 1948. 

In keeping with the Scout oath of thriftiness, the Lafayette Dads Club has been saving their wreath sales’ fundraising surplus for over 30 years. By tapping deep into their reserves, they are able to contribute $100,000 toward the $270,000 cost without fully depleting the Troop's annual operating expenses.

Contributions made prior to the launch of this campaign have already closed the needed fundraising gap to $100,000. We are now appealing to all Troop families, 204 alumni, and friends to help save our cabin. Since we know that a number of contributors would prefer to donate appreciated stock or pay by check, we have set the Indiegogo fundraising target at $50,000. We hope that you feel like we do—that the cabin is worth saving, and that the future of Troop 204 is worth investing in. We are grateful for your support and generosity. 

District Camporee Ribbons.

 Cabin Interior.

Scouting Creates Leaders

The log cabin at the corner of School Street and First Street has been home to Lafayette Boy Scout Troop 204 for over 66 years of our 84-year-old history. Inside this weathered building, boys of all ages have learned how to tell a clove hitch from a bowline knot, pledged allegiance to the flag, practiced camporee drills, and nervously sat through board-of-review meetings on the same benches some of their fathers sat on years before. This year, our enrollment is at an all-time high of 95 active boys.   

 Troop 204 - then and now.

Over 350 Eagle Scouts have earned their rank through Troop 204, far exceeding the national average. And with those achievements, at least 35,000 service hours have benefited local, national, and international causes. During their time with the troop, each boy will have hiked well over 500 miles, worn through several pairs of boots, learned to eat and sleep in the wilderness and, along the way, become leaders of their own patrol. You can learn more about the troop at our site: Troop204.com

Risks & Challenges

We have committed to complete this project. We have a bridge loan, if needed, to finish the work. If we don't achieve our goals for the campaign, we will be creative and develop a new fundraising approach. The project could cost more than expected - we have built into our budget a typical 20% contingency fund to cover unexpected costs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute to this campaign or not, we appreciate your having learned more about Troop 204 and our cabin, and we hope you will help us promote the campaign by sharing it with your social networks or via email using the sharing buttons at the top of the page. We really appreciate your support!

story:
The Big Picture

Thanks for checking out this project! My name is Tom and I am taking the trip of a lifetime - to Death Valley. I need help renting equipment to be able to perfectly capture the beauty that is Death Valley. My flight is booked, and my trip is from March 16 to March 19, 2016. Most of this time spent in the desert will be focused purely on my work and ensuring the pictures come out perfect.

Better Equipment Equals Better Prints

In most cases, a better camera does not take a better photo; however, better equipment allows for higher levels of detail to be captured by the image sensor, resulting in ultra-crisp beautiful photos that can be printed at ultra-huge sizes:

In addition to the small collection of camera gear that I currently own, my goal is, with your help, to rent this equipment.
I have three goal points of $500, $700, and a reach of $900.
Any donations that exceed my goals will go directly to ensuring that you get the highest quality prints possible!

    Base Kit ($500 Goal Met):
  • Canon EF 70-200 mm f/2.8L IS USM II
  • Pelican Carry on Case
  • Canon BP-E6 Battery
  • Canon EF 2x III
  • Induro Carbon Fiber CT113 Tripod with Kirk Ballhead
  • Canon EF 16-35 mm f/2.8L
    Medium Kit ($700 Goal Met):
  • Canon EOS 6D Digital SLR (Second Body)
  • Canon EF 300mm f/4L IS USM Lens
  • Canon BP-E6 Battery (Second)
  • Canon MP-E 65mm f/2.8 1-5x Macro
  • And everything in the Base Kit
    High Kit ($900 Goal Met):
  • Canon EOS 5Ds R Digital SLR (Instead of 6D)
  • Canon EF 300mm f/2.8L IS II USM (Instead of f/4L Version)
  • Canon EF 11-24mm f/4L USM Lens  
  • Delkin Devices USB 3.0 Universal Memory Card Reader
  • And everything in the Base & Medium Kits 
     Stretch Extras (Surpass $900):
    Now that I have passed $900 I will put the rest of the contributions towards purchasing a setup that will allow for extended astrophotography sessions. This will help me capture detailed photographs of the stars, galaxies, and beyond!

The Fine Prints

Your contribution will earn you a choice of print editions from my journey. My high quality Canon printer allows for incredible prints up to 13" by 19". Bigger donations lead to bigger prints (and more of them!) Extremely generous donations will give you the option to have the image of your choice printed on a variety of premium materials (Metal, Canvas).

Risks & Challenges

The problem with running a project like this is that I cannot show you what the final product will look like. I can show you my portfolio, and hope that you feel it is indicative of a worthy investment.


Every dollar helps, but if you can't donate, please share this around, and hopefully we can get some exposure!

story:
NoGunList.org

(Please visit the website under construction) http://www.NoGunList.org

Guns In The Wrong Hands Kill People.

You Are The Solution.

Government is not able to solve this so WE THE PEOPLE will.

NoGunList.org is creating a free public database dedicated to keeping firearms out of the wrong hands. Our mission is to dramatically reduce gun violence in our country. Through this site the general public, registered weapons dealers, sellers at guns shows and private gun selling citizens can check if a weapons purchaser has been flagged as being potentially questionable in their intent to own a firearm.

Help us to prevent gun violence by sharing honest information about someone who may be a threat to others or to themselves, or by checking NoGunList.org before selling or transferring a firearm. Together we can keep guns out of the wrong hands.

 

Mission Statement

Our mission is to dramatically reduce the amount of gun violence in this country by helping to keep firearms out of the wrong hands.  Government background checks can do only so much, and it is our belief that more needs to be done.

As is witnessed by history, many people who did pass a government background check and purchased firearms went on to use them to kill innocent people. In these cases it is often very clear to friends, neighbors, coworkers or family members that these individuals should not have had firearms sold to them.  NoGunList.org hopes to close this information gap and keep individuals who clearly should not be in possession of weapons from purchasing them. This is an open forum where the public can provide information about a potentially dangerous individual or do research before selling a firearm to someone. 

We are determined to make a difference and with your help we can make this country a safer place.

 

About Us

We are concerned citizens addressing the complicated issue of gun violence in our society. We believe it is our duty to create this database to keep guns from getting into the hands of potentially dangerous individuals.  At NoGunList.org we are not anti-gun, in fact we are strong supporters of the 2nd amendment.  But, something needs to be done, and relying on the government has clearly not worked up till now. We have decided to take matters into our own hands, and we hope you will join us.  We need your help to make this country a safer place.

 

Donate

We're determined to make a difference and we need your help to do it.

We need financial support in the form of donations to fund this national project/cause and to keep it improving and growing as a resource of efficiency and information. 

Funds collected will allow us to finalize our not-for-profit status. To finish building out our interactive website (searchable databases, Google mapping programs, data fetching software, RSS feeds and encryption software). To hire a full time staff to monitor the collected data and continuously make improvements. To retain legal counsel to combat and defend against the inevitable naysayers and opposition to creating a privately created database. And finally to advertise No Gun List to the general population through traditional and non-traditional media placements and to allow us to sponsor existing and newly created community awareness programs and events.

But we need more than your money. We need your support. Help spread the word. Report what you know. You can do it anonymously so you and your family do not have to live in fear of retaliation. Help us inform one another. Help us restore peace in our country. Together we can make our communities safer places to live, work, and thrive.

Save a life. List someone you know to be in the possession of illegal firearms. List someone who has threatened gun violence against you or someone you know. List a person who you think is morally incapable or unsuitable of purchasing or owning a firearm. Or List a person who is displaying suicidal tendencies.

At NoGunList.org, you don't have to worry about your name being made public. We only collect the lister's name and email address for our authorization records and hold it confidential in our encrypted database.

We are on a quest to make public information completely free and easily accessible to ensure weapons don't get into the hands of people who cannot accept the responsibility that comes with the ability and right to possess a firearm.

We simply want to curb gun violence.

 

PROFILE REMOVAL POLICY.

The NoGunList.org Profile Removal Policy is designed to work under the same framework as the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Millennium_Copyright_Act.

If you feel that your listed profile is unfair or felonious and should be removed from NoGunList.org then please go to the "Contact Us" page and send us a request to have your profile removed. We will remove your profile and send the lister of your profile an affidavit to sign if they wish the profile to remain published. Upon receipt of this affidavit we will repost your profile and original content. If the lister does not respond or refuses to sign the affidavit then your profile will remain removed.

If any litigation should arise as to the content of any profile in any court proceedings and NoGunList.org is subpoenaed by any legal entity then the lister's affidavit will be surrendered to that legal entity.

Any signer of our affidavit is hereby notified of the seriousness of perjury in conjunction with publishing false information of any individual and should only do so if information is serious and credible.

Government is not able to solve this so WE THE PEOPLE will. 
NoGunList.org is creating a free public database dedicated to keeping firearms out of the wrong hands. Our mission is to dramatically reduce gun violence in our country. Through this site the general public, registered weapons dealers, sellers at guns shows and private gun selling citizens can check if a weapons purchaser has been flagged as being potentially questionable in their intent to own a firearm. Help us to prevent gun violence by sharing honest information about someone who may be a threat to others or to themselves, or by checking NoGunList.org before selling or transferring a firearm. Together we can keep guns out of the wrong hands.
 

Mission Statement
Our mission is to dramatically reduce the amount of gun violence in this country by helping to keep firearms out of the wrong hands.  Government background checks can do only so much, and it is our belief that more needs to be done. As is witnessed by history, many people who did pass a government background check and purchased firearms went on to use them to kill innocent people. In these cases it is often very clear to friends, neighbors, coworkers or family members that these individuals should not have had firearms sold to them.  NoGunList.org hopes to close this information gap and keep individuals who clearly should not be in possession of weapons from purchasing them. This is an open forum where the public can provide information about a potentially dangerous individual or do research before selling a firearm to someone.   We are determined to make a difference and with your help we can make this country a safer place.
 
About Us
We are concerned citizens addressing the complicated issue of gun violence in our society. We believe it is our duty to create this database to keep guns from getting into the hands of potentially dangerous individuals.  At NoGunList.org we are not anti-gun, in fact we are strong supporters of the 2nd amendment.  But, something needs to be done, and relying on the government has clearly not worked up till now. We have decided to take matters into our own hands, and we hope you will join us.  We need your help to make this country a safer place.
 
Donate
We're determined to make a difference and we need your help to do it. We need financial support in the form of donations to fund this national project/cause and to keep it improving and growing as a resource of efficiency and information. 
Funds collected will allow us to finalize our not-for-profit status. To finish building out our interactive website (searchable databases, Google mapping programs, data fetching software, RSS feeds and encryption software). To hire a full time staff to monitor the collected data and continuously make improvements. To retain legal counsel to combat and defend against the inevitable naysayers and opposition to creating a privately created database. And finally to advertise No Gun List to the general population through traditional and non-traditional media placements and to allow us to sponsor existing and newly created community awareness programs and events.
But we need more than your money. We need your support. Help spread the word. Report what you know. You can do it anonymously so you and your family do not have to live in fear of retaliation. Help us inform one another. Help us restore peace in our country. Together we can make our communities safer places to live, work, and thrive. Save a life. List someone you know to be in the possession of illegal firearms. List someone who has threatened gun violence against you or someone you know. List a person who you think is morally incapable or unsuitable of purchasing or owning a firearm. Or List a person who is displaying suicidal tendencies.  At NoGunList.org, you don't have to worry about your name being made public. We only collect the lister's name and email address for our authorization records and hold it confidential in our encrypted database. We are on a quest to make public information completely free and easily accessible to ensure weapons don't get into the hands of people who cannot accept the responsibility that comes with the ability and right to possess a firearm.  We simply want to curb gun violence.
 
PROFILE REMOVAL POLICY.The NoGunList.org Profile Removal Policy is designed to work under the same framework as the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Millennium_Copyright_Act.  If you feel that your listed profile is unfair or felonious and should be removed from NoGunList.org then please go to the "Contact Us" page and send us a request to have your profile removed. We will remove your profile and send the lister of your profile an affidavit to sign if they wish the profile to remain published. Upon receipt of this affidavit we will repost your profile and original content. If the lister does not respond or refuses to sign the affidavit then your profile will remain removed.  If any litigation should arise as to the content of any profile in any court proceedings and NoGunList.org is subpoenaed by any legal entity then the lister's affidavit will be surrendered to that legal entity. Any signer of our affidavit is hereby notified of the seriousness of perjury in conjunction with publishing false information of any individual and should only do so if information is serious and credible.

story:
An Anti-Theft Belt Created To Last

The truth is we live in the age of planned obsolescence. Most products built today are not meant to last and create large amounts of unnecessary waste. We've grown accustomed to using our clothes and other accessories for a few months, maybe two years tops. Here at ALPAKA, we like to do things a little bit differently. All of our gear is engineered to last. We believe in constructing high-quality goods that will make you feel proud to wear them. The Stealth Belt is no exception. 

We invite you to keep reading on to discover why this belt could be the travel solution you've been looking for.

 

 

The Stealth Belt is an anti-theft belt that looks and functions like a normal belt but is equipped with cleverly hidden compartments that allow you to completely conceal your cash or keys. It's also adjustable (one size fits all from 24" to 38") and easy to use. Larger sizing (> 38) available at the end of campaign. 

It's also great whenever you have..ahem..an emergency (yeah, we went there) and need to quickly unbuckle it. Simply lift the pull tab and boom, it's unbuckled. Since the buckle is magnetic, it's just as easy to buckle it back up. 

 

 

The Fidlock buckle is constructed from nylon 66, fibreglass and rustproof stainless steel.

 

 

DEMO

 

Have you ever found yourself having to change your SIM while overseas but not being able to find a pin to eject the tray? The Stealth Belt comes with a SIM Tray Pin Pull Tab so you never have to deal with this problem again. You can also store a SIM card inside the pull tab. 

 

 

But that's not all. The Stealth Belt wouldn't be complete with a travel system. There are 3 extra components to the belt that will make your travel experience a breeze. This is the Stealth Belt System:

 

 

 

The Magnetic Cardholder eliminates the need for a lanyard and simplifies the way you commute. It's also great for holding ID cards for work, etc.

It's sustainable as it's mostly made from upcycled materials from our other products.

 

We're bringing you the Stealth Belt Travel System at a very affordable price. The reason we do this is to show our appreciation for believing in us. This is our 7th crowdfunding campaign and we're fully confident in our ability to deliver. Nevertheless, we like to see things from your point of view and understand that backing a crowdfunding campaign is placing your trust in the creator's expertise to deliver. We think you'll be pleasantly surprised. Whether this is your first time, your 7th time or somewhere in between time backing us, a heartfelt thank you for being part of the journey.

Please Share This Project

Know someone who will love this project?

Let them know about it by clicking on the buttons below:

 

WE ARE ALPAKA

We have a true passion for style, sustainability, and function. We believe combining all of these things can improve the way we live.

It's been almost 3 years since we launched our first crowdfunding campaign. This would have never been possible without the support of our backers and this is only the beginning.

Our foundation is bags. But we're not stopping there. Our mission is to create highly functional products that are durable and great looking.

ALPAKA products are meant to be used every day but are also packed with convenient travel features, blurring the line between everyday and travel.

Thank you for being part of the ride.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We've launched seven crowdfunding campaigns in 3 years. The real challenge starts after the campaign ends and the funds are released. We know that with our experience we will be able to produce the bag and have it shipped to backers by November – 2019. We have the full support of the manufacturer and fulfilment has already been planned.

Even though we do not see any direct risks, there are always unforeseen circumstances that may present themselves during production and fulfilment. If this were to occur, we will always be 100% transparent with you and communicate this to you right away. As with all of our previous campaigns, our goal is to design, produce and deliver an awesome, high-quality bag you are excited about, and we will do everything we possibly can to make that happen.

story:
Premium materials, organized, and low profile. Everything you'll ever need in a toiletry bag!

We launched this campaign for the Explorer SLIM in 2017 and are shipping this bag now from our website www.workbygravel.com.

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

The Premium Toiletry Pack is the best toiletry bag ever designed. It's sleek, sturdy, and adaptable. It was designed to keep your toiletries organized nicely while you travel. We've designed this to solve some of the top problems we've experienced (or seen others experience) while traveling.

 

 

 

Here's The Problem:

We often find that people are currently carrying their toiletries in plastic bags, bulky cases, and even foregoing a toiletry bag all together and just packing their toiletries in random nooks and crannies of their main travel bags. Toiletry bags on the market often have no organization options and feature just one or maybe two compartments.  

 

Spilling your shampoo all over everything is the worst and mixing all of your toiletries together is way gross. One of our least favorite thoughts is picturing our nail clippers rubbing up against our toothbrush. Why should your toothbrush be in the same pocket as your toenail clippers? We thought there had to be a much better way.

 

Here's The Solution:

We designed a toiletry bag that stays slim whilst packing a ton of toiletries in an organized manner with six separate pockets. We've used only premium materials so it is very rugged/sturdy, cleans easily, and just feels fantastic in your hands. We're super excited about this! Here's why:

  • Deodorant & Razor Pocket - A mesh pocket with a curved zipper for easy access. It fits all deodorant stick sizes. There is room for a razor and whatever small items you can pack inside (i.e. contact case). (9” Length x 3.5” Wide)
  • Toothbrush & Toothpaste Pocket -  A waterproof toothbrush & travel size toothpaste pocket. This pocket is solely for your toothbrush in order to keep your toothbrush from gathering debris & from rubbing up against anything but your pearly whites. (9” Length x 1.5” Wide)
  • Large Outer Pocket w/Soft Fleece Lining - This pocket spans the length of the back of the pack and has a soft fleece lining to protect valuables. Store your phone, watch, passport, cords, etc. (7” Length x 5” Wide)
  • Deep Pocket - A mesh pocket to fit your essentials. Pack this how you’d like! We were able to easily fit a travel mouth wash, beard oil, q-tips, mustache wax, flossers, and finger nail clippers. Psst ladies - this pocket fits tampons! The pocket is 5” wide so your tampons slide in and out easily. (5” Length x 5” Wide) 
  • Deep Waterproof Pocket - Store your liquids here to ensure that you don’t arrive to your destination with a shampoo explosion all over everything. Use travel size containers to fit shampoo & body wash. (4” Length x 5” Wide)
  • Secret Small Pocket -  Well I guess this pocket isn’t a secret anymore is it? This pocket is inside the deodorant & razor pocket. It can store rings or other small items that you want to keep from sliding around in one of the bigger pockets. (3” Length x 2” Wide)
  • Stowaway Adjustable Strap With Buckle - Sometimes it’s just convenient to hang your toiletry bag. We built a special pocket on the back of the toiletry bag with a stowaway strap & buckle. This pocket sits behind the large outer pocket to maximize storage space. Now your toiletry bag can hang anywhere or lay flat, neat huh? (Each strap is 8 1/2” Long. Pocket is 3 1/2” Tall x 5” Wide)
We are also so confident in the bag's build that we also cover this bag under a lifetime warranty!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Premium Materials & Durability

We used premium materials and didn't cut any corners. 

  • Outer Shell - The bag's outer shell is made from Tarpaulin PVC (Non Toxic & the same material used in many dry bags). This bag will take a beating, wash easily, and stay light to reduce weight in your pack.
  • Mesh - We used a Poly & PVC mesh to keep it very washable and durable.
  • Toothbrush Pocket + Lower Waterproof Pocket Lining - TPU (Thermoplastic Polyurethane) to keep these pockets sealed off from the rest of the bag.
  • Inside Lining - Poly & TPE (Thermoplastic Elastomer).
  • Weight - 7.23 oz

Chris and Lance met in August of 2016. Chris confronted Lance at a party and Chris had the idea for a toiletry pack for a while but really wanted to work with a designer to make sure he could have the best product possible. So when he found out that Lance was a designer and Lance had launched many products in the past Chris wanted to meet him and pitch him his idea. 

Lance thought it was a great idea and Chris and Lance became the best of friends. Chris and Lance then went on to design, sew their own samples, hold focus groups, start over from scratch, design, and re-design again until they came up with this final production sample!

 

Lifetime Warranty!

We are so confident in our product's build that we have added a lifetime warranty, plain and simple.
 
It doesn't cover general wear & tear by using the item for other than it's intended purpose.
 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Deodorant & Razor Pocket (9” Length x 3.5” Wide)
  • Toothbrush & Toothpaste Pocket (9” Length x 1.5” Wide) 
  • Large Outer Pocket w/Soft Fleece Lining (7” Length x 5” Wide) 
  • Deep Pocket (5” Length x 5” Wide)  
  • Deep Waterproof Pocket (4” Length x 5” Wide) 
  • Secret Small Pocket (3” Length x 2” Wide) 
  • Stowaway Adjustable Adjustable Strap w/Buckle (Each strap is 8 1/2” Long. Pocket is 3 1/2” Tall x 5” Wide) 

We are passionate about creating amazing products and Indiegogo is a way for us to launch our brand. As you've read Indiegogo isn't a store and perks are a thanks for supporting the project. Your pledge means so much and we take it very seriously so that we can build a fantastic product.

Lance thought it was a great idea and Chris and Lance became the best of friends. Chris and Lance then went on to design, sew their own samples, hold focus groups, start over from scratch, design, and re-design again until they came up with this final production sample!

 
Lifetime Warranty!
We are so confident in our product's build that we have added a lifetime warranty, plain and simple.
 
It doesn't cover general wear & tear by using the item for other than it's intended purpose.
 

 

 

 
 

 


Deodorant & Razor Pocket (9” Length x 3.5” Wide)
Toothbrush & Toothpaste Pocket (9” Length x 1.5” Wide) 
Large Outer Pocket w/Soft Fleece Lining (7” Length x 5” Wide) 
Deep Pocket (5” Length x 5” Wide)  
Deep Waterproof Pocket (4” Length x 5” Wide) 
Secret Small Pocket (3” Length x 2” Wide) 
Stowaway Adjustable Adjustable Strap w/Buckle (Each strap is 8 1/2” Long. Pocket is 3 1/2” Tall x 5” Wide) 


What Won't Fit?Toiletries are so different in size. It's safe to say that travel sized items will fit. Not all travel sized bottles are equal in size so please refer to the dimensions of the product to measure out if your desired item will fit or not. Electric Razors - In this version of this toiletry bag, most electric razors will not fit. Check the dimensions above to see if your electric razor would fit. Most do not fit. 
Return Policy?We only used premium products and offer a lifetime warranty. We will repair or replace any bags that don't hold up to what the bag was designed to be used for. We do not offer refunds or returns on bags that were received as a Indiegogo reward.
We are passionate about creating amazing products and Indiegogo is a way for us to launch our brand. As you've read Indiegogo isn't a store and perks are a thanks for supporting the project. Your pledge means so much and we take it very seriously so that we can build a fantastic product. 

Contact InfoCustomer Service Team: hello@workbygravel.com

story:
Haven is a hammock... only comfortable. It's a tent... but easy to set up and take down. We've combined the best of hammock camping and tent camping into one amazing lay.
 

Our patent pending design creates a flat and ergonomic sleeping platform, no matter how you sleep...

Every Kickstarter package includes the shell with detachable rainfly and mosquito netting, two simple poles, straps, guy lines, and a custom air mattress.

Suspension Arcs keep the sidewalls low while supporting the flat sleeping platform. Think suspension bridge! 

  • Unobstructed views
  • Easy in and out
  • Lay flat as a pancake

Internal Spreader Bars keep the interior space open.

  • No pressure on sides

The Air Mattress with horizontal tubing creates a soft spacious sleeping platform.

  • More wiggle room
  • Insulation

The Structural Ridgeline means you lay flat regardless of tree spacing.

  • Stability
  • Place to hang your gear  

Along with the tent body, the air mattress has been meticulously designed. 23”x78”x3” (52x198x7cm) Aided by the internal foot pump, the pad inflates in less than 60 seconds. 

New to hammock camping? All overnight hammocks require an air mattress or underquilt for insulation.  A comparable ultralight air mattress costs $110+ 

Forecast calls for rain? Or just headed to the park? Be prepared with the whole system wherever you go, or trim it down further to reduce weight. Rainfly 14 oz (.4 kg) Mosquito netting 5 oz (.1 kg).  

Do you need a hammock, bug net, rainfly, camp shelter, playground, or bivy?

No trees? No problem... Haven makes a great bivy. Trekking poles not included.

The Haven Tent will retail for $315. By placing your pre-order here on IndieGoGo, you can get the entire package (tent, pad, straps, rainfly, guy-lines, and stakes) for $290 with free domestic shipping. That's ~$40 in savings! Yes please...

 

Now shipping! While supplies last we will be shipping Haven with the Ultralight Pad as soon as your order comes in. 

 

The Haven team is small and compact, like our amazing tent. We are supported by great prototypers and manufacturing partners who have years of experience bringing products to market. 

As Utah natives, we love the outdoors and have very high standards for our gear. We wanted a product that would make us happy campers, so that's what we created. 

The Haven shell and rainfly constructed with High Tensile Rip-Stop Nylon PU Coated. The air mattress is made with 20D Nylon. 

Weight capacity 280 lbs (127 kg) and pad length 6'6" (198 cm)

story:
We wanted a faster and more reliable way to prepare, organize, carry and access our crucial camp gear, so we made the world's most versatile outdoor adventure kit.

VSSL Camp Supplies takes the form of a traditional flashlight and extends its functionality way beyond illumination. Every VSSL is perfectly stocked with over 70 pieces of essential outdoor gear that doesn't compromise on quality, weight, or valuable pack space. It’s like the Swiss army knife of camp gear, and it'll change the way you prepare for outdoor adventure.

 

Outdoor gear is in a constant state of innovation, getting lighter and easier to pack, except when it comes to the camping essentials. This is the stuff that can make or break a trip. You know the essentials checklist; a flashlight, a way to start a fire, purify water, bandage a wound, rope for a dry line, and tape to repair gear. There hasn't been a way to keep all these critical items ultra-packable, organized, and in one place for easy access, until now.

 

 

Packing every last inch of VSSL Camp with useful gear has been our obsession for over three years. But not just any gear. We’ve found the right mix of quality, functional gear that you’d want on you anytime you head out into the wild. Each piece has been carefully chosen and organized into clearly labeled screw top containers, so you know exactly where your essential gear is when you need it most. The result: when you grab your VSSL, you know you're ready for outdoor adventure.

 

VSSL Camp wasn’t created by marketing focus groups in some boardroom. It was invented by our founder, Todd Weimer, while he was growing up in Northern Canada. Todd and his best friend wanted to make packing and carrying their outdoor gear easier so they could prepare more quickly, and head out into the wild with confidence. 

A few decades later Todd found himself inspired by his childhood experiences, and wanting to help others be better prepared for outdoor adventure. Holding an LED light one day, Todd found his muse. He realized that the handle of a traditional flashlight could now be used to house more purposeful gear. Todd hasn’t stopped packing critical outdoor gear into VSSL’s ever since. VSSL Camp Supplies is the result, and we’re confident that it’ll be the best damn thing you put in your backpack this year.

When you’re in the wild, the last thing that you want to worry about is your gear. That’s why we sent early prototypes of VSSL Camp Supplies out to a group of serious adventurers that we knew would put its functionality and durability to the test. Meet the professional explorers, coast guards, and guides that put VSSL Camp through its paces.

 * Kickstarter uses your country of origin to determine which currency is displayed in our reward levels. Because we’re a Canadian company all our reward levels are converted from CAD to your countries currency. That’s why there may be a small discrepancy between our US reward amounts listed below, and what is listed by Kickstarter.  

We've partnered with Suunto, the world's best compass maker, for a Suunto Compass upgrade option. After the campaign, when you get your Backerkit survey, you'll be given the option to upgrade from our standard compass to a Suunto edition compass.

If you've got some questions about the VSSL campaign that aren't in our FAQ, click "Chat With Us" below to be auto-magically taken to Facebook Messenger. We'll do our best to get back to you within a day.  

VSSL doesn’t just make quality outdoor gear, we also care about making an impact on our community. That’s why, since we first started, we’ve partnered with Communitas; a not-for-profit that serves young people with special needs. It's often hard for these young folks to find good employment that is sustainable, so we decided to help make a change. 

After all the parts of a VSSL arrive at our warehouse in Abbotsford B.C., they get carefully assembled by some of the exceptional young people that are a part of the Communitas program. We love having them as a part of the VSSL family and we’re extremely proud of their work; we’ve maintained a defective rate of less than 1% in the entire 4 year history of the brand. Thanks for helping us make a difference.

We love the crowdfunding community and what they represent; helping to launch innovative and purposeful new products. Crowdfunding is also a great way for us to gauge product viability and (hopefully!) increase quantities for pricing benefits on production runs. That’s why Kickstarter and Indiegogo are the first places people will be able to get their hands on a VSSL Camp Supplies. We have a little history with crowdfunding too.  

Four years ago VSSL launched through Crowdfunding. At the time we knew nothing about digital marketing, or how to run a Kickstarter campaign. Fortunately, those early (and rough) versions of VSSL were well received. And despite a lot of bumps in the road, we had a successful product launch!  

While the original VSSL was the distillation of Todd’s (VSSL’s founder) experience from his youth and as an outdoorsman, the all NEW VSSL Camp is everything the original VSSL was, with years of experience and feedback being poured into improving every component of our flagship product.  

Over these last 4 years we’ve learned so much. We’ve made many improvements and the product quality is now world class. We’re proud to be launching VSSL Camp Supplies through crowdfunding and want to thank you for your support in helping us keep people prepared for outdoor adventure.
story_txt:
We wanted a faster and more reliable way to prepare, organize, carry and access our crucial camp gear, so we made the world's most versatile outdoor adventure kit.VSSL Camp Supplies takes the form of a traditional flashlight and extends its functionality way beyond illumination. Every VSSL is perfectly stocked with over 70 pieces of essential outdoor gear that doesn't compromise on quality, weight, or valuable pack space. It’s like the Swiss army knife of camp gear, and it'll change the way you prepare for outdoor adventure. 
 
  Outdoor gear is in a constant state of innovation, getting lighter and easier to pack, except when it comes to the camping essentials. This is the stuff that can make or break a trip. You know the essentials checklist; a flashlight, a way to start a fire, purify water, bandage a wound, rope for a dry line, and tape to repair gear. There hasn't been a way to keep all these critical items ultra-packable, organized, and in one place for easy access, until now. 
 
  Packing every last inch of VSSL Camp with useful gear has been our obsession for over three years. But not just any gear. We’ve found the right mix of quality, functional gear that you’d want on you anytime you head out into the wild. Each piece has been carefully chosen and organized into clearly labeled screw top containers, so you know exactly where your essential gear is when you need it most. The result: when you grab your VSSL, you know you're ready for outdoor adventure.  
 
 VSSL Camp wasn’t created by marketing focus groups in some boardroom. It was invented by our founder, Todd Weimer, while he was growing up in Northern Canada. Todd and his best friend wanted to make packing and carrying their outdoor gear easier so they could prepare more quickly, and head out into the wild with confidence. A few decades later Todd found himself inspired by his childhood experiences, and wanting to help others be better prepared for outdoor adventure.
